data.title: Best Hotels for London Marathon Runners, their Families & Supporters
data.meta_description: Training for the London Marathon and don't have hours to spend looking for a hotel? Let me help you. This posts shares the best options for hotels near the start and finish lines, and in Central London, with perks such as complimentary breakfast and room upgrades.
data.text:
Central London

Covent Garden or Leicester square area. Walking distance from the Finish line (so that you can freshen up after a glorious performance and to celebrate with friends, family, and fellow runners). Also close to Charing Cross station for the train to Greenwich (via London Bridge) and the Start line.

Liverpool Street and other mainline stations are also well connected and can be used as the base from which to travel to/from the race and explore the capital, or if you’re planning on doing some sightseeing, catching a show in the West End, or going shopping.

Henrietta Hotel, Covent Garden

Near the Start Line

InterContinental – The O2

Holiday Inn Express London, Greenwich

Other Areas

The Stratford Hotel

Location: This is located in Stratford, which is further out however it’s right next to the station with good connectivity and multiple tube, train, DLR lines going through here. According to TFL, it would take 32 mins to Greenwich (with one change on the DLR, plus walking to the Start line from there). Then it’s 30 mins back from Charing Cross, after you finish running.

Perks included when you book with me

Complimentary breakfast for 2 daily

Upgrade to a Larger room

Some healthy (!) marathon amenities

Conrad London St James Park

Location: St James’ Park station (District & Circle line). Requires a couple of changes to get to the Start line but it’s walking distance from the Finish line.

Perks included when you book with me

Complimentary breakfast for 2 daily

100 USD equivalent hotel credit to spend in hotel during the stay

Upgrade or late checkout, subject to availability

Double Hilton points

Novotel London Blackfriars

Location: Near Blackfriars station. Train to Greenwich for the Start line

Hilton London Tower Bridge

Location: Near London Bridge station. Train to Greenwich for the Start line

Summary

Choosing the right hotel can enhance your London Marathon experience, providing the perfect blend of comfort and convenience. Whether you’re looking for a luxury London hotel or a budget-friendly option, the city has a variety of accommodations to suit your needs. Working with a local travel advisor ensures you book your stay at one of these top hotels, so you’re well-rested and ready to tackle the marathon with ease. And after the race, you can enjoy a well-earned cocktail or pint!

Here’s to a successful race and an unforgettable visit to one of the world’s most iconic cities!
